member.name: T:Tool
member.summary: Before use this module, Please import first: import "Mods\Tool" The Useful ToolBox module made by OFDL Taiwan.

member.name: M:getArrayMaxMin
member.summary: Gets the min and max value and index from array.

member.name: M:select
member.summary: Returns the value wired to the t input or f input, depending on the value of s. If s is "True", this function returns the value wired to t. If s is "False", this function returns the value wired to f.
member.param: s determines whether the function returns the value of t or f in s? t:f.
t is the value that this function returns if s passes a "True" value.
f is the value that this function returns if s passes a "False" value.

member.name: M:constrain
member.summary: Constrains a number to be within a range.
member.param: The lower end of the range.
The upper end of the range.

member.name: M:wrap
member.summary: Wrap values from a range into the range. For Example, lower bound is 0, upper bound is 100, if input 110, result will output 10, or input 130, result will output 30, and so on.
member.param: The lower end of the range.
The upper end of the range.

member.name: M:map
member.summary: Re-maps a number from one range to another. That is, a value of fromLow would get mapped to toLow, a value of fromHigh to toHigh, values in-between to values in-between, etc.
member.param: The lower bound of the value’s current range.
The upper bound of the value’s current range.
The lower bound of the value’s target range.
The upper bound of the value’s target range.

member.name: M:atan2
member.summary: Returns the arc tangent of the two numbers x and y.

member.name: M:atan2_m90
member.summary: Returns the arc tangent of the two numbers x and y. But result minus 90, make some odometry more convenient.
